member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.DataGrids.GridView
member.summary: Displays data in a two dimensional grid resembling a spreadsheet. Allows users to select, group and traverse through large data sets efficiently.
member.remarks:
Setting the property to the collection representing the datasource will automatically display all the data in the datasource.
To control which columns from the datasource are displayed, add specific s within the GridView. To learn more about this control see the list of GridView tutorials.

member.name: T:ComponentArt.Silverlight.DataVisualization.DataGrids.PivotGrid
member.summary: PivotGrid class. Allows end-users interactive, out-of-the-box navigation of multi-dimensional data sources.
member.remarks:
To connect the control to a multi-dimensional data source, we need only to set its property to an object inheriting from . An implementation of this that is capable of connecting directly to XMLA-based entry points into OLAP databases (like Microsoft Analysis Services), and is included in the Data Visualization package, is the XMLA MdDataSource ().
In order to allow the end user to analyze all the dimensions available in the Analysis Services cube, we can introduce a to our page. End-users can drag specific data dimensions and measures from the PivotTree onto the PivotGrid's headers in order to change the view To learn more about this control see the list of PivotGrid tutorials.

member.summary: PivotTree class. Allows the end user to hierarchically browse through all the available data dimensions and measures in the specified data source.
member.remarks: To connect the control to a multi-dimensional data source, we need only to set its property to an object inheriting from . An implementation of this that is capable of connecting directly to XMLA-based entry points into OLAP databases (like Microsoft Analysis Services), and is included in the Data Visualization package, is the XMLA MdDataSource (). Also allows specific data dimensions and measures to be dragged onto the PivotGrid's headers in order to change the view.
